metadata.title: Dromedary camels in northern Mali have high seropositivity to MERS-CoV-NC-ND license (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/)

abstract.original_text: A high percentage (up to 90%) of dromedary camels in the Middle East as well as eastern and central Africa have antibodies to Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV). Here we report comparably high positivity of MERS-CoV antibodies in dromedary camels from northern Mali. This extends the range of MERS-CoV further west in Africa than reported to date and cautions that MERS-CoV should be considered in cases of severe respiratory disease in the region.

sentences.segment_text: A high percentage ( up to 90 % ) of dromedary camels in the Middle East as well as eastern and central Africa have antibodies to Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus ( MERS-CoV ) .
Here we report comparably high positivity of MERS-CoV antibodies in dromedary camels from northern Mali .
This extends the range of MERS-CoV further west in Africa than reported to date and cautions that MERS-CoV should be considered in cases of severe respiratory disease in the region .
